com.projetloki.genesis.image

Class MathFunctions

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.projetloki.genesis.image.MathFunctions

  • public final class MathFunctions
extends Object
    Static utility methods pertaining to MathFunction instances.

    All methods return serializable functions.

    Author:
    Clément Roux

    • Method Summary

      Returns a constant function.

      Returns the identity function.

    • Method Detail

      • identity

        public static MathFunction identity()
        Returns the identity function.

        MathFunctions.identity()

      • constant

        public static MathFunction constant(double value)
        Returns a constant function. It associates the given value with each number in [0, 1]

        MathFunctions.constant(0.3)

        Parameters:
        value - the function value. Must be between 0 and 1.

      • pow

        public static MathFunction pow(double r)
        Returns the function f(x) = x ˆ r

        MathFunctions.pow(0.5)

        Parameters:
        r - the exponent

      • linear

        public static MathFunction linear(double y0,
                  double y1)
        Returns a linear function with the given values at x = 0 and x = 1

        MathFunctions.linear(0.2, 0.5)

        Parameters:
        y0 - the function value at x = 0. Must be between 0 and 1.
        y1 - the function value at x = 1. Must be between 0 and 1.

      • forVertices

        public static MathFunction forVertices(Point v0,
                       Point v1,
                       Point... others)
        Returns a function whose graph has the given vertices, joined by segments.

        The list of vertices must satisfy these conditions:

        • The x-coordinate of the first vertex must be 0
        • The x-coordinate of the last vertex must be 1
        • Each x/y-coordinate must be between 0 and 1
        • The vertices must be ordered by x-coordinate

        MathFunctions.vertices(
    new Point(0, 0.6),
    new Point(0.25, 0.2),
    new Point(0.6, 0.5),
    new Point(0.6, 0.8),
    new Point(1, 1))

        Parameters:
        v0 - the first vertex
        v1 - the second vertex
        others - the other vertices
